description: The Master of Science in Accounting (MS in Accounting) is a 30-credit graduate program designed for individuals who wish to develop the skills and knowledge necessary to pursue a career in public accounting, and meet the 150-credit hour licensure requirement in New York State. The graduate program also serves as a foundation for doctoral studies and other business-related professional careers.
Accreditation status: Our undergraduate and graduate programs are accredited by AACSB International-the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business. Less than five percent of business schools worldwide have earned this distinction.
Program name: Master of Science in Accounting

description: The Advanced Certificate in Adapted Physical Education is a 15-credit program of study that results in a recommendation for New York State certification as a teacher of adapted physical education. The program is specifically designed to meet the academic requirements for the New York State certification exam in adapted/special physical education. The program is offered fully online. This program is designed for individuals who have already earned initial or professional NYS certification in physical education and have completed a master's degree. The courses focus on developing knowledge and skills in the areas of assessment, instruction, and consultation as they pertain to teaching physical education to students with disabilities.
Program name: Adapted Physical Education (Advanced Certificate)

description: The Master of Science in Education in Adolescence Education program is a 36-39 credit graduate program that prepares students for initial and/or professional certification as a secondary classroom teacher in New York State. This program is for students who do not have a teaching certification. Program concentrations are available for the following content areas: biology, chemistry, earth science, English, French, mathematics, physics, social studies and Spanish. This program leads to an MSEd degree and eligibility for New York State Initial Teacher Certification in Adolescence Education, grades 7-12, in the student’s academic specialty. An option for dual certification in TESOL or Students with Disabilities is also available. Successful completion of the program and passing of all required New York State certification examinations (EAS, edTPA, and appropriate CST) will lead to the College’s recommendation for the Initial Certificate.
Accreditation status: Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP)
Program name: Master of Science in Education in Adolescence Education: Biology

description: Our Adolescence Inclusive Generalist Education programs lead to dual certification in the student’s content area and Students with Disabilities Generalist (7-12). The program is for students who have already earned an undergraduate degree in one of the content areas listed below. Our programs are nationally recognized by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP). We are also proud to have a very high employment rate for our graduates.
Accreditation status: The Teacher Education programs at SUNY Brockport are accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).
Program name: Adolescence Education: Biology + Students with Disabilities Certification (Advanced Certificate)

description: Are you a problem-solver? A mentor? A leader? Do you want to work with adolescents of all abilities? Our adolescence inclusive general-ed program is for you. This program leads to dual certification in your content area (grades 7-12) and as a Teacher of Students with Disabilities (grades 7-12). Our program is committed to preparing teachers to meet the needs of all learners in today's diverse classrooms. Students will engage in coursework that focuses on content-specific pedagogy and inclusive practices, including co-teaching and collaboration, differentiating instruction, and culturally responsive-sustaining education. Through a series of carefully planned field experiences, students will have the opportunity to implement what they have learned with the mentorship of our expert faculty.
Accreditation status: The educator preparation programs (advanced level) at SUNY Brockport are accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).
Program name: Master of Science in Education in Adolescence Education: Biology + Students with Disabilities Certification

description: The Master of Science in Education in Adolescence Education is intended for students who have completed an undergraduate major in the area in which they seek certification. We offer certification in the following content areas: Biology, Chemistry, Earth Science, English, French, Mathematics, Physics, Social Studies, and Spanish. Completion of this program leads to a master's degree and initial and professional New York State teacher certification in Adolescence Education (grades 7-12) in the student's area of concentration. The program prepares teachers to meet the needs of a diverse student population and promotes the development of critically reflective practitioners who are student advocates.
Accreditation status: All teacher education programs are accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).
Program name: Master of Science in Education in Adolescence Education: Chemistry

description: The Adolescence Inclusive Generalist Education with Students with Disabilities program prepares candidates to teach in secondary schools (grades 7-12). Our program provides initial teacher certification for those with a bachelor’s degree in one of the following content areas: English, French, social studies, Spanish, biology, chemistry, earth science, mathematics, or physics. The program is designed for students who do not hold a teaching certificate. Candidates will complete the program as a cohort, taking courses that are carefully sequenced to build on one another, and are tied to two semester-long field experiences. You'll work closely with expert faculty in a supportive, student-centered environment. Upon completion of the program, candidates are eligible for both an initial teaching certificate in their content area and in teaching students with disabilities (generalist).
Accreditation status: The School of Education, Health and Human Services at SUNY Brockport is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).
Program name: Adolescence Education: Chemistry + Students with Disabilities Certification (Advanced Certificate)

description: The Inclusive Adolescence Education program leads to a Master of Science in Education (MSEd) and recommendation for Initial and Professional New York State teacher certification in both Adolescence Education (Grades 7-12) and Teaching Students with Disabilities (Grades 7-12) in a specific content area. This program is a 45-48 credit program designed for candidates who have a bachelor’s degree in one of the content areas in which we offer certification, or the equivalent in coursework.
Accreditation status: The School of Education, Health, and Human Services at SUNY Brockport is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP) and the Association for Advancing Quality in Educator Preparation (AAQEP).
Program name: Master of Science in Education in Adolescence Education: Chemistry + Students with Disabilities Certification

description: Our Master of Science in Education in Adolescence Education: Earth Science is for students who have a bachelor’s degree in geology or a related field and are seeking an initial teaching certificate. Our program is nationally recognized by the National Science Teachers Association (NSTA).
Accreditation status: All teacher certification programs at SUNY Brockport are accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP). The Adolescence Education - Science Education program, which includes Earth Science, is nationally recognized by the National Science Teachers Association (NSTA).
Program name: Master of Science in Education in Adolescence Education: Earth Science

description:
SUNY Brockport offers a Master of Science in Education in Adolescence Education that leads to Initial and Professional New York State teacher certification in one of seven content areas for grades 7-12. All of our adolescence education programs lead to dual certification in your chosen content area and students with disabilities.

This is a 45-48 credit hour program designed for students who have an undergraduate degree in the content area they wish to teach, but lack a background in education. It is an intensive, field-based program that immerses students in a school setting from the very first semester. Students complete coursework that provides them with the tools and resources they need to serve all students, including those with special needs.

There is no GRE requirement for this program.
Accreditation status: The Teacher Education Unit at SUNY Brockport is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).
Program name: Master of Science in Education in Adolescence Education: Earth Science + Students with Disabilities Certification

description: The Adolescence Inclusive Generalist Program leads to an initial and professional New York State teaching certificate in the candidate's content area (grades 7-12) and teaching students with disabilities at the same level (generalist). The program is nationally recognized by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP). The program offers a master's degree, an advanced certificate, or a combined master's/advanced certificate program. Coursework focuses on adolescent development and learning, curriculum and instruction in the content area, and adapting instruction for all learners, including those with disabilities.
Accreditation status: The program is nationally recognized by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).
Program name: Adolescence Education: Earth Science + Students with Disabilities Certification (Advanced Certificate)

description:
Become a teacher who is qualified to teach all learners in grades 7-12. Our master’s program leads to dual certification in your content area and in teaching students with disabilities.

The Adolescence Inclusive Generalist Program leads to a Master of Science in Education and prepares teacher candidates to work with students in grades 7-12, including students with disabilities. The program leads to Initial and Professional New York State teacher certification in a content area (grades 7-12) and in Teaching Students with Disabilities (grades 7-12 Generalist).
Accreditation status: The Teacher Education programs at SUNY Brockport are accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).
Program name: Master of Science in Education in Adolescence Education: English

description: This program is designed for candidates who already hold an initial and/or professional teaching certificate in English (grades 7-12) and want to become certified to teach students with disabilities at the same grade level. It combines online and on-campus courses, making it an excellent option for working professionals. Through this program, you will develop a deep understanding of disabilities and their effect on learning. You’ll learn how to develop appropriate Individualized Education Programs (IEPs), adapt curricula, and assess student learning. We’ll also prepare you to create a safe, supportive classroom where you can effectively partner with families and other school professionals.
Accreditation status: All of our teacher preparation programs are accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).
Program name: Adolescence Education: English + Students with Disabilities Certification (Advanced Certificate)

description: Our dual-certification master’s degree program prepares graduates to become effective English teachers for all students in grades 7-12, including those with disabilities. The program offers a unique focus on young adult literature, the teaching of writing, and literacy in the disciplines. Graduates of this program are well prepared to meet the demands of teaching the diverse population of students in today’s schools. You will earn a Master of Science in Education (MSEd) and be eligible for both initial and professional NYS certifications in English Language Arts (7-12) and Students with Disabilities (7-12 Generalist). This program provides both the master’s degree and the teacher certifications needed by most public school districts. The required coursework can be completed on a full-time or part-time basis, through a combination of on-campus and online coursework. We offer all required courses on a rotating schedule that makes it easy to plan your program of study. As a student in our program, you will benefit from individualized advisement and a variety of field experiences in diverse settings.
Accreditation status: All of our educator preparation programs are accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).
Program name: Master of Science in Education in Adolescence Education: English + Students with Disabilities Certification

description: The Master of Science in Education in Adolescence Education is a 42-45 credit program for students who have a bachelor's degree in a content area, but are not certified to teach. The adolescence program prepares students to teach in grades 7-12. As a student in our program, you will develop the professional knowledge, skills and dispositions necessary to become a highly qualified teacher and educational leader. The program leads to Initial and Professional New York State teacher certification in one of the following content areas: English, social studies, mathematics, biology, chemistry, earth science, or physics.
Accreditation status: All of our teacher education programs are accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).
Program name: Master of Science in Education in Adolescence Education: Mathematics

description: The Advanced Certificate in Adolescence Education: Mathematics + Students with Disabilities is for students who are already certified in Mathematics 7-12, but who are also seeking Students with Disabilities 7-12 Generalist certification. As a student in this program, you will complete 15 credits of coursework designed to meet the academic requirements for initial/professional certification in Students with Disabilities 7-1_ Generalist. Coursework is aligned with both New York State requirements for certification and Council for Exceptional Children (CEC) standards for teacher preparation. The program is fully online, with synchronous courses that are offered in the late afternoon/evening.
Accreditation status: The Division of Education and Human Development at SUNY Brockport is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP), 1140 19th St NW, Suite 400, Washington, DC 20036, (202) 223-0077.
Program name: Adolescence Education: Mathematics + Students with Disabilities Certification (Advanced Certificate)

description: The Adolescence Inclusive Generalist Program is for candidates who have completed an undergraduate degree in an approved content area and want to become a certified teacher. The program leads to a Master of Science in Education (MSEd) and dual initial teaching certification in a specific content area (grades 7-12) and in Teaching Students with Disabilities (grades 7-12).
Accreditation status: All teacher education programs at SUNY Brockport are accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).
Program name: Master of Science in Education in Adolescence Education: Mathematics + Students with Disabilities Certification

description: The Adolescence Education: Physics program is a master’s level program that leads to New York State teacher certification in physics (grades 7-12). Our program includes a comprehensive foundation in the teaching of science combined with extensive field experience to prepare you to enter the teaching profession and succeed in your classroom.
Accreditation status: All teacher certification programs at SUNY Brockport are accredited by the Association for Advancing Quality in Educator Preparation (AAQEP).
Program name: Master of Science in Education in Adolescence Education: Physics

description: The Adolescence Inclusive Generalist Program leads to a recommendation for an additional teaching certificate in Students with Disabilities 7-12 Generalist. Candidates must already possess an initial or professional certificate in an adolescence content area in order to be admitted into this program. Through this program, you will gain the knowledge and skills to successfully teach all students in the inclusive classroom. You will learn to collaborate and co-teach with other professionals as you work in our partner schools. This program also fulfills the master’s degree requirement for professional certification.
Accreditation status: SUNY Brockport’s Department of Education and Human Development is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).
Program name: Adolescence Education: Physics + Students with Disabilities Certification (Advanced Certificate)

description: Become a more marketable teacher. Our Master of Science in Education in Adolescence Inclusive Generalist Education is a dual-certification program. This program prepares you to become an inclusive educator, certified to teach a content area in grades 7-12 AND certified to teach students with disabilities in grades 7-12. The program can be completed in as little as three semesters. It includes a full year of residency, where you will teach alongside a mentor in a local school. It offers you the opportunity to work and build relationships with a diverse group of students in an inclusive school setting. You will also have the opportunity to participate in our international professional semester programs in England, New Zealand and Australia.
Accreditation status: The Teacher Education programs at SUNY Brockport are accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).
Program name: Master of Science in Education in Adolescence Education: Physics + Students with Disabilities Certification

description: SUNY Brockport offers Master of Science in Education (MSEd) degrees that lead to Initial and/or Professional New York State teacher certification in Adolescence Education (grades 7-12). These programs are for individuals who have a bachelor’s degree in the content area they wish to teach, or the equivalent (see content core requirements). Our Adolescence Education programs include a combination of coursework in pedagogy (the art and science of teaching) and a variety of field experiences in local schools. We offer programs in: Biology, Chemistry, Earth Science, English, Mathematics, Physics, Social Studies, Spanish, French.
Accreditation status: All teacher education programs at SUNY Brockport are accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).
Program name: Master of Science in Education in Adolescence Education: Social Studies

description: This program is designed for students who already have an initial certification in Social Studies 7-12 and a master's degree. Students will take courses to obtain an additional certification in Students with Disabilities 7-12. As a nationally-accredited program, our graduates are highly sought-after. Most are employed as special education teachers in public schools and bring a wealth of expertise to the field. Our graduates can also teach social studies in a special class setting in public schools. Students may pursue this program on a part-time or full-time basis.
Accreditation status: All teacher education programs at SUNY Brockport are accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).
Program name: Adolescence Education: Social Studies + Students with Disabilities Certification (Advanced Certificate)

Concentration name: Social Studies + Students with Disabilities Certification
description: The Adolescence Inclusive Generalist Program leads to a Master of Science in Education (MSEd) and recommendation for NYS initial and professional teacher certification in both an adolescence content area (grades 7-12) and in teaching students with disabilities at the same grade level. This program is for candidates who have completed an undergraduate major in the content area for which they are seeking certification, but do not yet hold a teacher certification. The program is designed to prepare teachers to work with a broad range of students, including those with disabilities, in grades 7-12 classrooms. This 45-48 credit program can be completed in four semesters of full-time study. Part-time options are also available.
Accreditation status: The Teacher Education programs at SUNY Brockport are accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).
Program name: Master of Science in Education in Adolescence Education: Social Studies + Students with Disabilities Certification

description: Our Advanced Certificate in Aging Studies program enhances the knowledge and skills of individuals from various disciplines and professions. The program is specifically designed to provide specialized academic training in gerontology for graduate students and practitioners in the field of aging who wish to become more knowledgeable about the aging process and the needs of older people. This flexible, 15-credit graduate-level program may be taken separately or with a graduate degree program in another discipline. Courses are open to both matriculated and non-matriculated students.
Program name: Aging Studies (Advanced Certificate)

description: The Master of Science in Athletic Administration is a 36-credit, fully online program that will prepare you for a successful career in the exciting and competitive world of sports. Whether you are a current or aspiring athletic administrator, coach, or sports professional, our program will equip you with the skills and knowledge you need to lead and manage athletic programs at all levels, from interscholastic to intercollegiate. Our program is designed to provide you with the essential skills and knowledge needed to excel in the dynamic field of athletic administration. You will learn to: Lead and manage athletic programs effectively. Develop and implement strategic plans for athletic departments. Manage budgets and financial resources. Ensure compliance with legal and ethical standards in athletics. Promote a positive and inclusive culture within athletic programs. Market and promote athletic programs to various stakeholders.
Program name: Master of Science in Athletic Administration

description: The Master of Science in Athletic Training (MSAT) is a 54-credit, two-year full-time cohort program that prepares students to become highly skilled and competent athletic trainers. The program emphasizes the promotion of life-long learning and an evidence-based practice approach to clinical decision making. Students will gain valuable clinical experience under the direct supervision of a certified and licensed athletic trainer and/or physician. Upon completion of the program, students will be eligible to sit for the Board of Certification, Inc. (BOC) examination.
Accreditation status: SUNY Brockport is currently accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Athletic Training Education (CAATE), 2001 K Street NW, Third Floor – North, Washington, DC 20006 USA. The program has chosen to voluntarily withdraw its CAATE accreditation effective August 18, 2023 and is no longer accepting new students.
Program name: Master of Science in Athletic Training

description: The Bilingual Education Advanced Certificate program provides certified teachers the opportunity to obtain a bilingual extension to their current NYS teaching certificate. Candidates will develop a strong foundation in the theory and practice of bilingual education in order to effectively meet the needs of bilingual learners in a variety of program models. Through a combination of coursework and field experiences, candidates will be prepared to implement culturally and linguistically sustaining pedagogies in their content area, to build partnerships with families and communities, and to serve as leaders and advocates for bilingual learners in all school settings.
Program name: Bilingual Education (Advanced Certificate)

description: The Bilingual Education master’s program is a 30-36 credit program that prepares certified teachers to work with bilingual students in a variety of settings. The program also leads to eligibility for New York State certification in Bilingual Education.
Program name: Master of Science in Education in Bilingual Education

description: A Master of Business Administration (MBA) is one of the most prestigious and sought after postgraduate degrees in the world. An MBA can benefit professionals in a variety of fields, including management, marketing, finance, and accounting. A SUNY Brockport MBA offers you a quality education and a strong return on your investment. We prepare our students for successful careers in business, non-profit, and government organizations. Flexible, personalized, and affordable. Take classes online or on campus. You choose which option is best for you on a class-by-class basis. Attend full- or part-time. Personalize your degree by selecting elective courses that match your career goals. Take advantage of our extensive alumni network, internship opportunities, and career services. All of this at an affordable SUNY price.
Accreditation status: The School of Business is accredited by AACSB International, The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business. Less than five percent of business schools worldwide have earned this distinction.
Program name: Master of Business Administration

description: The Master of Science in chemistry program is a research-based program designed to enhance the skills of the baccalaureate chemist, or to provide a basis for further study at the doctoral level. The program is flexible enough to allow students to concentrate in a sub-discipline in which they are most interested. All students are required to conduct original laboratory research in conjunction with one of the department’s research groups and to complete a written thesis.
Program name: Master of Science in Chemistry

description: Our Master of Science in Education in Childhood Inclusive Education is a 30-credit program that prepares you to meet the needs of a wide range of students in today's diverse classrooms. This program is for students who already hold an initial certification in childhood education (grades 1-6) and are looking for a master's degree that can lead to a professional certification in both childhood education and students with disabilities (grades 1-6). The program of study includes classes focusing on the unique needs of children with disabilities, literacy instruction, and research.
Program name: Master of Science in Education in Childhood Inclusive Education

description: The Master of Science degree in college student affairs and development provides an opportunity for students interested in working in higher education to receive a professional education. The program’s mission is to educate professionals who are committed to creating systems that are accessible and equitable for all students. We use theory-to-practice and cohort-based models to prepare professionals who will engage with college students and challenge systems to bring about positive change. The program meets the academic standards of the Council for the Advancement of Standards in Higher Education (CAS) and aligns with the ACPA/NASPA Professional Competency Areas for Student Affairs Practitioners. This program is offered in a hybrid format. All classes have a combination of in-person and online instruction.
Accreditation status: The program meets the academic standards of the Council for the Advancement of Standards in Higher Education (CAS) and aligns with the ACPA/NASPA Professional Competency Areas for Student Affairs Practitioners.
Program name: Master of Science in College Student Affairs & Development

description: The Master of Science in Computing Sciences program is designed for individuals who have an undergraduate degree in computer science or a related discipline and wish to deepen their knowledge and skills in this area. Our computing science graduate program provides students with a solid foundation in computer science through in-depth study of theory, software design, development and application of computers in a variety of fields. Students will learn how to: Apply theory to real-world problems. Master new technology. Work in a team. Take on leadership roles.
Program name: Master of Science in Computing Sciences

description: The Certificate of Advanced Study (CAS) in Creative Writing is an 18-credit post-baccalaureate program designed for students who are interested in creating a collection of original creative work while improving their creative writing skills and deepening their knowledge of the literary arts. The CAS in Creative Writing is ideal for students who wish to pursue a Master of Fine Arts in creative writing but may lack the creative writing coursework to be a strong candidate. It is also an excellent option for current teachers who want to strengthen their creative writing pedagogy. Classes are available in a variety of creative writing genres, including creative nonfiction, fiction, and poetry. Other course topics include studies in literary form and theory, as well as creative writing pedagogy.
Program name: Creative Writing (Advanced Certificate)

description: SUNY Brockport’s Doctor of Education (EdD) in Educational Leadership program is designed for practicing and aspiring P-12 school and district leaders. This innovative cohort-based program uses a practitioner-scholar model to develop students’ capacity to improve P-12 schools and districts. The program focuses on instructional leadership for equity, curriculum and instruction, organizational management, community relations, and leadership for social justice. This program is a member of the Carnegie Project on the Education Doctorate (CPED).
Program name: Doctor of Education in Educational Leadership
Master of Arts in English – Creative Writing

description: The MA in Literature at SUNY Brockport will develop your knowledge of literary history, theory, and criticism, while also honing your skills in close reading and scholarly writing. You’ll be prepared for advanced work in a doctoral program or for a variety of rewarding careers.
Program name: Master of Arts in English – Literature

description: The Master of Science in Environmental Science and Ecology is a research-based program that stresses an individualized, multidisciplinary approach to environmental problem solving. The program encourages students to combine aspects of environmental science, ecology, biology, chemistry, geology, physical science, and other related fields to create a program tailored to their specific interests and career goals. Students have the opportunity to collaborate with a faculty advisor and graduate committee of their choosing to create a unique curriculum and conduct thesis research on a topic of interest.
Program name: Master of Science in Environmental Science & Ecology

description: The Master of Healthcare Administration (MHA) program at SUNY Brockport prepares students for management and leadership careers in a wide range of healthcare settings, including hospitals, long-term care facilities, clinics, and community-based health organizations. Students learn to critically examine and evaluate issues and trends in the healthcare system. The curriculum is designed to provide both the breadth and depth of knowledge needed to succeed as a healthcare administrator. Courses emphasize healthcare organization, finance, reimbursement, law and ethics, quality improvement, and human resources. The MHA is a practice-based, professional degree. Students will apply classroom theory to the real-world in a culminating administrative internship in a healthcare organization of interest.
Program name: Master of Healthcare Administration

description:
The Master of Science in Education in Higher Education Administration at SUNY Brockport is designed for individuals who seek or hold professional positions in administration and student support services at colleges and universities.

Our curriculum is aligned with the student affair standards established by the Council for the Advancement of Standards in Higher Education (CAS) and the American College Personnel Association (ACPA)/National Association of Student Personnel Administrators (NASPA). Students are taught by full-time faculty and student affairs administrators with extensive experience in the field.

Students are required to complete a minimum of one internship (3 credit hours) in an approved higher education setting. Those with limited or no prior higher education experience must complete two internships. In addition, there are many opportunities for volunteering, research, and professional development.

Students may also elect to complete a thesis on a higher education topic of interest, under the guidance of a faculty member.
Program name: Master of Science in Education in Higher Education Administration

description: The Master of Arts in History at SUNY Brockport offers students advanced training in historical study. Students in the program develop sophisticated research, writing, and analytical skills and expand their historical knowledge through coursework and independent study. The program prepares students for a variety of careers in fields such as secondary and post-secondary education, public history, and government service, as well as for further study in doctoral programs. The History M.A. program requires 30 credits of graduate work, including 24 credits of coursework and 6 credits dedicated to researching and writing a master’s thesis.
Program name: Master of Arts in History

description: The MSEd in Instructional Design prepares students for a wide variety of exciting careers in all sectors (corporate, non-profit, K-12, and higher education). Instructional designers create a wide variety of learning solutions. Our program prepares instructional designers to work in the ever-changing and fast-paced world of learning and performance improvement by grounding them in the foundational theories and allowing them to create a wide variety of learning experiences, from mobile learning to virtual reality.
Program name: Master of Science in Instructional Design

description: This 12-credit, fully online Advanced Certificate in Instructional Design at SUNY Brockport prepares students to design, develop, implement, and evaluate effective and engaging learning experiences. The certificate can be completed as a stand-alone program or taken as part of a master’s degree in Education. This certificate provides educators, instructional designers, and training specialists with the cutting-edge skills and knowledge required to design effective and engaging learning for K-12, higher education, and corporate/non-profit settings. Students will learn the essentials of instructional design, multimedia design and development, and project management. The program is built around the core competencies of the profession, including theoretical and practical foundations, planning and analysis, design and development, implementation and management, and evaluation and assessment.
Program name: Instructional Design (Advanced Certificate)

description: The Master of Arts in Liberal Studies program is a graduate liberal studies program that allows students to study across the disciplines in the humanities, arts, natural sciences, and social sciences. It is an interdisciplinary program designed to meet the special needs and interests of individual students. The program provides a broad, interdisciplinary course of study for students who want to continue their education at the graduate level for intellectual enrichment, career advancement, or preparation for doctoral work.
Program name: Master of Arts in Liberal Studies

description: The Master of Science in Education in Literacy Education is for candidates who currently hold a teaching certificate and are seeking to further their knowledge in the field of literacy. Our graduates become literacy leaders in their schools and districts, literacy coaches, and classroom teachers with specialized knowledge in literacy. We offer three different tracks to meet the needs of our diverse graduate students: B-6, 5-12, and B-12. Each program is 30-credits and is offered fully online.
Accreditation status: The literacy education graduate programs are accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).
Program name: Master of Science in Education in Literacy Education Program

description:
The Advanced Certificate in Local Government Management provides current and aspiring local government managers with the knowledge and skills necessary for a successful career as a public manager. Students will learn the fundamental skills of municipal management from expert faculty and practitioners in the field.

The Advanced Certificate program is ideal for part-time students who are currently employed by a local government and wish to take the next step in their careers. It can be completed in as little as 12 months. All courses are available in-person or online, providing maximum flexibility for working professionals. Full-time students can supplement their MPA or other graduate degrees with an Advanced Certificate, which allows students to develop specialized knowledge and skills that complement a graduate degree.
Program name: Local Government Management (Advanced Certificate)

description: The 60-credit hour Master of Science in Clinical Mental Health Counseling program is designed for students who want to become licensed mental health counselors (LMHC). The curriculum gives students all the educational requirements they need to become an LMHC in New York State. The curriculum has a strong focus on practice. All students take three semesters of clinical courses: practicum and a two-semester internship. SUNY Brockport has its own community mental health counseling training clinic that serves as one of our main training sites for our practicum and internship students.
Accreditation status: The Council for Accreditation of Counseling and Related Educational Programs (CACREP), a specialized accrediting body recognized by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA), has granted accreditation to the Clinical Mental Health Counseling (MS) program at SUNY Brockport.
Program name: Master of Science in Mental Health Counseling

description: The Certificate of Advanced Study (CAS) in Mental Health Counseling Bridge Program provides the opportunity for individuals who currently have a master’s degree in a related field (e.g., school counseling, rehabilitation counseling, social work, psychology) to complete the coursework required to be eligible for licensure as a mental health counselor in New York State. The Bridge Program requires a minimum of 24 credits. The specific number of credits required for each student is determined by a transcript review and in consultation with a faculty advisor.
Program name: Certificate of Advanced Study in Mental Health Counseling Bridge

description: The Advanced Certificate in Nonprofit Management is a 15-credit, stand-alone certificate program that provides students with specific knowledge about the nonprofit sector. It also serves as a specialization for students in the Master of Public Administration (MPA) Program. The certificate program is appropriate for individuals currently employed in the nonprofit sector who are seeking additional professional development, for individuals who desire to become employed in the nonprofit sector, and for individuals whose employment requires them to interact with the nonprofit sector (e.g., government employees, board members).
Program name: Nonprofit Management (Advanced Certificate)

Concentration name: Adult Gerontology Primary Care Nurse Practitioner
description: The Adult-Gerontology Primary Care Nurse Practitioner program prepares graduates to provide primary care to the entire spectrum of adults, including young adults, adults, and older adults. The primary care NP role includes providing comprehensive and continuous care to patients; this care is characterized by a long-term relationship between the patient and the NP. Primary care includes risk-reduction, health promotion, disease prevention, and the management of acute and chronic illnesses. The program emphasizes the development of expertise in health promotion, clinical assessment, and disease management and is guided by a commitment to the care of vulnerable and diverse populations. Our graduates work in a variety of settings, including primary care offices, long-term care facilities, specialty clinics, and correctional facilities.
Accreditation status: The master’s degree program in nursing at SUNY Brockport is accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education, 655 K Street NW, Suite 750, Washington, DC 20001, (202) 887-6791.
Program name: Master of Science in Nursing - Adult Gerontology Primary Care Nurse Practitioner

description: Our Doctor of Nursing Practice (DNP) Program is a practice-focused doctoral program that prepares graduates to practice at the most advanced level of nursing. The program is designed for nurses who have earned a master's degree in nursing in an advanced practice specialty (e.g., nurse practitioner, clinical nurse specialist, nurse anesthetist, or nurse midwife), or in a specialty area of nursing leadership such as administration or informatics. Upon completion of the program, graduates will be able to: Provide leadership for evidence-based practice in a variety of settings. Apply clinical scholarship and analytical methods to improve patient outcomes. Serve as a catalyst for change to meet the health needs of a diverse society in a variety of settings. Advocate for health care policy to improve patient safety and quality of care.
Accreditation status: The baccalaureate degree program in nursing, master's degree program in nursing, and Doctor of Nursing Practice program at SUNY Brockport are accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education, 655 K Street NW, Suite 750, Washington, DC 20001, (202) 887-6791.
Program name: Doctor of Nursing Practice

description: The Certificate of Advanced Study (CAS) Family Nurse Practitioner (FNP) post-master’s program is a 33-credit program for registered nurses who hold a master’s degree in nursing and who wish to become an FNP. The program prepares students to provide primary care to individuals and families across the lifespan. The curriculum focuses on health promotion, disease prevention, and the diagnosis and management of common acute and chronic health problems. Upon completion of the program, students will be eligible to take the FNP certification exam.
Accreditation status: The baccalaureate degree program in nursing, master's degree program in nursing, and post-graduate APRN certificate program at SUNY Brockport are accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education, 655 K Street NW, Suite 750, Washington, DC 20001, (202) 887-6791.
Program name: Certificate of Advanced Study in Nursing - Family Nurse Practitioner

description: The Master of Science, Family Nurse Practitioner program prepares graduates to provide primary care to individuals and families. The program has a strong emphasis on health promotion and disease prevention. The program is designed to be completed through part-time study to allow students to continue to work as they advance their education. All courses have an online component. Some courses are completely online and some are offered in a hybrid format, with a combination of online and in-person classes. Through our rigorous curriculum and practical training, you will learn to: diagnose and treat acute and chronic health problems, promote health and prevent disease, order and interpret diagnostic tests, prescribe medications and other therapies
Accreditation status: The baccalaureate degree program in nursing, master's degree program in nursing, and post-graduate APRN certificate program at SUNY Brockport are accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education, 655 K Street NW, Suite 750, Washington, DC 20001, (202) 887-6791.
Program name: Master of Science in Nursing - Family Nurse Practitioner
Master of Science in Nursing Education
Master of Science in Education in Physical Education - Adapted

description: The Master of Science in Education in Physical Education is designed for individuals who are interested in advanced study within the field. Students can pursue one of three distinct tracks in our program: athletic administration, adapted physical education, or pedagogy. This track provides students the opportunity to combine their knowledge of physical education with the necessary business skills to become a successful athletic director at the interscholastic or intercollegiate level. The curriculum will prepare students to handle all aspects of an athletic program, including finance, legal issues, and marketing. A culminating experience of either a thesis, synthesis, or internship is required.
Program name: Master of Science in Education in Physical Education - Athletic Administration

description: The Master of Science in Education (MSEd.) in Physical Education is intended for individuals who have completed an undergraduate physical education degree and hold initial New York State (NYS) certification in physical education. This program of study allows candidates to develop the pedagogical content knowledge necessary to meet the challenges of teaching physical education in the 21st century. The program has been nationally recognized by the Society for Health and Physical Educators (SHAPE America) and leads to professional certification in New York State.
Accreditation status: The program has been nationally recognized by the Society for Health and Physical Educators (SHAPE America).
Program name: Master of Science in Education in Physical Education - Teacher Education Pedagogy

description: Our Master of Arts in Psychology program offers a strong foundation in psychological science. Our students gain the skills necessary to conduct psychological research as well as to apply psychological principles to a variety of settings. We pride ourselves on the collaborative relationships our faculty form with our students. Students have numerous opportunities to collaborate with faculty on research through independent studies and research assistantships. Many students co-author conference presentations and journal articles with faculty. The MA program is a good fit for students who plan to pursue a doctoral degree or who want to work in a research setting. All full-time students are guaranteed a graduate assistantship that includes a stipend and tuition waiver. Our students have had a great deal of success after graduation. Over the past 10 years, over 80% of our graduates who applied to doctoral programs were accepted. Others have gone on to work in a variety of research and human service settings.
Program name: Master of Arts in Psychology

Concentration name: Health Care Management, Public Safety, Nonprofit Management
description: SUNY Brockport’s Master of Public Administration (MPA) program is dedicated to enriching public and nonprofit life by preparing recent college graduates and mid-career professionals to be competent public managers and thoughtful public servants. Our graduates serve as leaders and managers in local, state, and federal government, as well as nonprofit organizations. Our curriculum is designed with the working professional in mind. The MPA degree is offered in two formats: a traditional on-campus format and a fully online format.
Accreditation status: The MPA Program at SUNY Brockport is accredited by the Network of Schools of Public Policy, Affairs, and Administration (NASPAA) Commission on Peer Review and Accreditation and is listed on the Annual Roster of Accredited Programs in conformity with NASPAA standards.
Program name: Master of Public Administration

description:
The Advanced Certificate in Public Health is intended to provide graduate-level education in public health for individuals who may be working in or plan to work in public health settings. This program is available 100% online.
Upon completion of the program, students will be able to:
1. Explain public health history, philosophy, and values.
2. Identify the core functions of public health and the 10 Essential Services.
3. Explain the role of quantitative and qualitative methods and sciences in describing and assessing a population’s health.
4. List the major causes and trends of morbidity and mortality in the US or other community.
5. Discuss the science of primary, secondary and tertiary prevention in population health, including health promotion, screening, etc.
6. Explain the critical importance of evidence in advancing public health knowledge.
7. Explain effects of environmental factors on a population’s health.
8. Explain the social, political and economic determinants of health and how they contribute to population health and health inequities.
9. Explain how globalization affects global burdens of disease.
10. Explain an ecological perspective on the connections among human health, animal health and ecosystem health (e.g., One Health).
Program name: Public Health (Advanced Certificate)

description: Our Master of Public Health (MPH) degree will prepare you to be a public health leader. You will learn to address pressing public health issues at the local, state, national, and global levels. This program provides a strong foundation in the core areas of public health, including epidemiology, biostatistics, environmental health, health policy and management, and social and behavioral sciences. You will gain hands-on experience through a required internship, where you will apply your knowledge and skills in a real-world setting. Graduates of our program are well-equipped for careers in a variety of settings, including government agencies, non-profit organizations, and private industry.
Accreditation status: The Master of Public Health program at SUNY Brockport is accredited by the Council on Education for Public Health (CEPH).
Program name: Master of Public Health

description: The Certificate of Advanced Study (CAS) in Educational Administration is offered in a fully online format and is designed for certified teachers and pupil personnel staff who have a master's degree and at least three years of professional experience. The CAS prepares graduates for New York State certification as a School Building Leader (SBL) and School District Leader (SDL). As a student in the Educational Administration program, you will learn to: lead and manage a school building and a school district; understand the link between theory, research, and the practice of educational leadership; develop skills to create and sustain a school culture and instructional program conducive to student learning and staff professional growth; collaborate with families and community members, responding to diverse community interests and needs and mobilizing community resources; and to act with integrity, fairness, and in an ethical manner.
Accreditation status: The Educational Administration program at SUNY Brockport is nationally recognized by the National Council for Accreditation of Teacher Education (NCATE).
Program name: Certificate of Advanced Study in School Building/District Leader

description: The Certificate of Advanced Study (CAS) in School Counseling is a 60-credit program for students who have a master’s degree in a related field and wish to become school counselors. The curriculum meets the academic requirements for provisional/permanent certification as a school counselor in New York State. The curriculum focuses on counseling, human development, and professional practice as it applies to school counseling. The program combines academic study with supervised practical experience in school counseling.
Accreditation status: The Counselor Education programs at SUNY Brockport are accredited by the Council for Accreditation of Counseling and Related Educational Programs (CACREP).
Program name: Certificate of Advanced Study in School Counseling

description: The Master of Science in Education in School Counseling is a 60 credit hour program designed to prepare students for careers as school counselors in P-12 school settings. This program provides students with core knowledge and skills in the areas of human growth and development, social and cultural foundations, helping relationships, group work, career and lifestyle development, appraisal, research and program evaluation, and professional orientation. This program also provides students with the specialized knowledge and skills to become effective school counselors.
Accreditation status: SUNY Brockport’s MSEd in School Counseling is a CACREP accredited program.
Program name: Master of Science in Education in School Counseling

description: Our Master of Science in Education in School District Business Leader prepares you to meet the NYS certification requirements for the School District Business Leader (SDBL). The SDBL is the chief financial officer of a school district. As SDBL, you are responsible for a variety of tasks including accounting, finance, and budgeting. This program is available 100% online. Our program is taught by experienced faculty, who have extensive experience in the field. Our program is designed to meet the rigorous demands and ever-changing environment in our school systems. You will learn about: Financial aspects of a school system including accounting, budgeting, state aid, purchasing, and capital projects; Management of all support services including food service, transportation, facilities, and technology; Personnel management, including contract negotiations and contract administration; State and Federal laws and regulations impacting school districts.
Program name: Master of Science in Education in School District Business Leader

description: The School District Business Leader (SDBL) Post-Master's Certificate program is a 21-credit program offered in a fully online format designed for students who already possess a master's degree and want to acquire New York State certification as a School District Business Leader. SDBL certification allows an individual to serve as the chief business official in a school district. The program develops the leadership and management skills necessary to effectively lead the business operations of a school district. The curriculum is composed of courses in school finance, school law, human resources and collective bargaining, principles of public school district leadership, and information management, followed by a one-year internship experience.
Accreditation status: The SDBL program is registered by the New York State Education Department (NYSED) and is a CAEP accredited program.
Program name: Certificate of Advanced Study in School District Business Leader

description: Our Master of Science in Education in School Health Education prepares students for advanced-level careers in school health education. The program leads to professional certification for teaching health in New York State public schools. This program provides students who possess an initial teaching certificate in health with the graduate coursework necessary to earn professional teaching certification in New York State. Candidates who do not possess initial certification in health education may earn it by combining this program with the health education certification program.
Program name: Master of Science in Education in School Health Education

Concentration name: Practice with children and families, Practice with older adults and their families
description: The Master of Social Work (MSW) program at SUNY Brockport is designed for students who are committed to social justice and to serving oppressed and disadvantaged populations. It prepares students for advanced social work practice. We are the largest MSW program in the Rochester area. Our MSW program boasts a diverse student body, an outstanding faculty, a variety of exciting field placement opportunities, a student-centered approach to learning, and a rigorous curriculum designed to help students acquire the skills necessary for effective social work practice.
Accreditation status: The Master of Social Work program at SUNY Brockport is accredited by the Council on Social Work Education (CSWE).
Program name: Master of Social Work

description: The Teacher Leader Program at SUNY Brockport is designed for practicing teachers who want to expand their professional impact beyond the classroom without leaving the classroom. The curriculum is intended to complement their existing teaching practices, not replace them. In fact, many of the projects in the program can be implemented in the candidate’s own classroom and school.
Accreditation status: The Teacher Leader program is a registered program through the New York State Education Department.
Program name: Teacher Leader (Advanced Certificate)

description: Teach English to speakers of other languages, and open yourself up to a world of opportunity. The Master of Science in Education in Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages (TESOL) is for students who have a passion for other cultures and want to help non-native English speakers learn the English language. This 30-36 credit program will lead to an initial and/or professional certification in TESOL for pre-K-12 students. We also offer a non-certification track for those who wish to teach English to adult learners or in other settings that do not require NYS certification.
Accreditation status: All teacher preparation programs are accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).
Program name: Master of Science in Education in Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages

description:
The Advanced Certificate in TESOL is intended for graduate students who already hold a master’s degree but wish to complete the requirements for New York State certification in English to Speakers of Other Languages (ESOL).

The program is 100% online, and can be completed by a full-time student in as few as three semesters. The Advanced Certificate program in TESOL (Teaching English to Speakers of other Languages) is approved by the New York State Education Department for teacher certification, and completion of the program leads to a recommendation for certification for those who meet all requirements.

The department is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP). The Department of Education and Human Development has an excellent faculty who are well known in their fields and are highly respected for their scholarship, teaching, and service.

Students who complete the Advanced Certificate program in TESOL will be prepared to assist school districts in applying for ESOL teacher certification from the New York State Education Department.
Accreditation status: The Advanced Certificate program in TESOL (Teaching English to Speakers of other Languages) is approved by the New York State Education Department for teacher certification...The department is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).
Program name: Advanced Certificate in Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages

description:
The Advanced Certificate in Women & Gender Studies (WMS) is a 12-credit program that addresses historical and contemporary issues of women, gender, and sexuality from an interdisciplinary perspective. All students take WMS 601 Feminist Principles and WMS 602 Global Feminisms. You can complete the remainder of the program by taking nine credits of designated courses that deal with women, gender, and sexuality in different fields. Some of the many options include courses in Anthropology, Communication, Counselor Education, English, History, Public Administration, and Sociology. This certificate helps graduate students to broaden their knowledge in the exciting field of women and gender studies, and enhance their career opportunities.

The Advanced Certificate in Women & Gender Studies helps students to think critically about the ways that gender and sexuality shape our experiences. This certificate is valuable to students in a number of master’s programs, including history, English, public administration, and mental health counseling. It is also a good choice for people who work in human services, non-profit organizations, and education, who want to enhance their professional credentials.
Program name: Women & Gender Studies (Advanced Certificate)
